ar.com.hjg.pngj
Class ImageLines

java.lang.Object
  ar.com.hjg.pngj.ImageLines

public class ImageLines
extends java.lang.Object

Wraps in a matrix a set of image rows, not necessarily contiguous - but equispaced. The fields mirrors those of ImageLine, and you can access each row as a ImageLine backed by the matrix row, see getImageLineAtMatrixRow(int)

Field Summary
 int bitDepth
           
 int channels
           
 int elementsPerRow
           
 ImageInfo imgInfo
           
 int nRows
           
 int rowOffset
           
 int rowStep
           
 boolean samplesUnpacked
           
 ImageLine.SampleType sampleType
           
 int[][] scanlines
           
 byte[][] scanlinesb
           
 
Constructor Summary
ImageLines(ImageInfo imgInfo, ImageLine.SampleType stype, boolean unpackedMode, int rowOffset, int nRows, int rowStep)
          Allocates a matrix to store nRows image rows.
 
Method Summary
 ImageLine getImageLineAtMatrixRow(int mrow)
          Returns a ImageLine is backed by the matrix, no allocation done
 int imageRowToMatrixRow(int imrow)
          Warning: this always returns a valid matrix row (clamping on 0 : nrows-1, and rounding down) Eg: rowOffset=4,rowStep=2 imageRowToMatrixRow(17) returns 6 , imageRowToMatrixRow(1) returns 0
 int imageRowToMatrixRowStrict(int imrow)
          Same as imageRowToMatrixRow, but returns negative if invalid
 int matrixRowToImageRow(int mrow)
          Converts from matrix row number (0 : nRows-1) to image row number

equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

Constructor Detail

ImageLines

public ImageLines(ImageInfo imgInfo,
                  ImageLine.SampleType stype,
                  boolean unpackedMode,
                  int rowOffset,
                  int nRows,
                  int rowStep)
Allocates a matrix to store nRows image rows. See ImageLine and PngReader.readRowsInt() PngReader.readRowsByte()

Parameters:
imgInfo -
stype -
unpackedMode -
rowOffset -
nRows -
rowStep -
Method Detail

getImageLineAtMatrixRow

public ImageLine getImageLineAtMatrixRow(int mrow)
Returns a ImageLine is backed by the matrix, no allocation done

Parameters:
mrow - Matrix row, from 0 to nRows This is not necessarily the image row, see imageRowToMatrixRow(int) and matrixRowToImageRow(int)
Returns:
A new ImageLine, backed by the matrix, with the correct ('real') rownumber

imageRowToMatrixRow

public int imageRowToMatrixRow(int imrow)
Warning: this always returns a valid matrix row (clamping on 0 : nrows-1, and rounding down) Eg: rowOffset=4,rowStep=2 imageRowToMatrixRow(17) returns 6 , imageRowToMatrixRow(1) returns 0

imageRowToMatrixRowStrict

public int imageRowToMatrixRowStrict(int imrow)
Same as imageRowToMatrixRow, but returns negative if invalid

matrixRowToImageRow

public int matrixRowToImageRow(int mrow)
Converts from matrix row number (0 : nRows-1) to image row number

Parameters:
mrow - Matrix row number
Returns:
Image row number. Invalid only if mrow is invalid
